page.title: 05FARMING:MACHINES & BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the farming land is devoted to the growing of crops, particularly cereals such as wheat and barley. So { {FARM MACHINERY}is used mainly for cultivation: ploughs, harrows,rotary cultivators, combine havesters and seed drills. There are only about 10 farms in the block, so these tend to be quite large up to 1000 acres, so farm{BUILDINGS}are well spaced out with the occasional old barn, perhaps derelict, breaking up the otherwise monotonous{LANDSCAPE.}On the smaller farming units expensive machinery is sometimes shared. One farmer with 630 acres of mainly arable farmland reported that the land was of good quality and that like many other farmers it had been handed down to him from one generation to another. With only 3 employed to help him, the farms are not a great consumer of labour.
